comments:
We have seen this failure appear once and a while during automated tests:

Should have been suspended at linenumber expected:<35> but was:<26> 

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Should have been suspended at linenumber 
expected:<35> but was:<26>
at 
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.core.ExceptionBreakpointTests.testHitCountException
(ExceptionBreakpointTests.java:144)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.DebugSuite$1.run(DebugSuite.java:53)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

altered AbstractDebugTest.terminateAndRemove to wait for the the TERMINATE event before returning 
(if the process is not already terminated) and to turn the suspend on uncaught exception preference off 
before resuming and terminating. 
The suspend event that we receive (on line 26) seems to be coming from a different test which may not 
have terminated properly because on an uncaught exception.
haven't seen this test failure for a few days.

traces.message: Should have been suspended at linenumber  expected:<35> but was:<26>
